title: Technical Program / Pilot Analyst (Robotics & Facilities) â€“ Contract
description:
**Location:** 
 India
 



**Duration:** 
 2â€“3 months (contract)
 



**Time Commitment:** 
 Full\\-time preferred
 



**Compensation:** 
 $1,000 â€“ $2,00 per month (based on experience)
 



  





 About the Role
 



 We are looking for a
 **Technical Program / Pilot Analyst** 
 to support early\\-stage work on
 **humanoid robotics pilots** 
 focused on HVAC, facilities, and industrial environments.
 



 This is a
 **hands\\-on, execution\\-focused role** 
 working directly with the founder on real customer discovery calls with
 **mining, pharma, facilities, and industrial companies** 
 . The work involves
 **analyzing real\\-world operations, documenting pilot requirements, and helping shape product and business decisions** 
 .
 



 This is
 **not a research internship and not a pure coding role** 
 . It is about understanding how technology fits into real operations.
 



  





 What You Will Do
 


* Prepare for and attend customer discovery calls (listening, note\\-taking, structured follow\\-ups)
* Analyze operational workflows, constraints, and pain points
* Identify inspection, monitoring, safety, and labor\\-reduction opportunities
* Convert conversations into
 **clear 1â€“2 page pilot briefs**
* Help map customer needs to:
* HVAC inspection MVP scope
* data center / industrial applicability
* Support internal planning for robotics pilots and early go\\-to\\-market efforts
* Assist with documentation used for BD, product planning, and partner discussions



 Who This Role Is For
 


* Recent graduates, graduate students, or early\\-career professionals (0â€“3 years)
* Background in:
* engineering (mechanical, electrical, systems, robotics, computer science), or
* applied AI, automation, industrial systems
* Strong ability to:
* listen carefully
* synthesize complex discussions
* write clearly and concisely
* Comfortable working with ambiguity and incomplete information
* Interested in
 **applied robotics, industrial automation, and real\\-world AI deployment**



 Nice to Have (Not Required)
 


* Exposure to robotics, automation, HVAC, facilities, manufacturing, or industrial operations
* Experience with technical documentation, product analysis, or consulting\\-style work
* Comfort participating in professional customer calls (listening role)



 What This Role Is NOT
 


* Not a research or academic role
* Not a pure software engineering role
* Not a sales or marketing role
* Not a guaranteed long\\-term position



 This is a
 **short, focused execution role** 
 designed to support real pilots.
 



  





 Why This Is a Good Opportunity
 


* Direct exposure to early\\-stage robotics and AI pilots
* Work closely with a repeat founder
* Learn how pilots, MVPs, and customer discovery actually work
* Strong resume signal for robotics, AI, product, or consulting paths
* Flexible, remote\\-friendly structure
